page.title: 14FUN AND GAMES
page.content: { Television}came in{1970}and people were glued to it, but now again there is a lot of{home visiting}_ with sone {whisky}and some{songs. { New Year}is very special indeed, with at least a week's visiting.{Halloween has some impenetrable{disguises. { Badminton}is played in the island's Hall; a{Carpet Bowls Club and an 'Over {Forties' Club}meet in the School. { Whist Drives}and most{generous Bring {and Buy Sales}are held in the Hall in holiday times. Then{bands}are brought in and{Ceilidh Dances}are held _ but the indefatiguable{local accordionist has gone to{Australia.}There are still {Gaelic singers}very much appreciated. { Popular dances}are Canadian Barn Dance, Strip the Willow, Gay Gordons, Hesitation Waltz, Dashing White Sergeant, Highland Schottische, Boston Two Step.{Discos}have been held.
